void TTEOutput::handleMessage ( cMessage *  msg  )  [protected, virtual]

Forwards the messages from the different buffers and LLC according to the TTEthernet specification.

Time-triggered messages are send immediately, rate-constrained and best-effort messages are delayed if they do not fit in the gap until the next time-triggered message. If the lower layer is idle messages are picked from the queues according to the priorities. Time-triggered buffers can free the bandwidth reservation mechanism by sending a TTBufferEmpty message.

Parameters:
msg the incoming message

00149             if (priority > 0 && priority < NUM_RC_PRIORITIES)

00159             }
00160         }
00161     }
00162     //Frames arrived on in are best-effort frames
00163     else if (msg->arrivedOn("in"))
00164     {
00165         // If there are framesRequested the MAC layer is currently idle
00166         if (framesRequested && isTransmissionAllowed((EtherFrame*) msg))
00167         {
00168             framesRequested--;
00169             msg->addPar("sent").setLongValue(((TTEScheduler*)getParentModule()->getParentModule()->getSubmodule("tteScheduler"))->getTicks());
00170             msg->addPar("sent_total").setLongValue(((TTEScheduler*)getParentModule()->getParentModule()->getSubmodule("tteScheduler"))->getTotalTicks());
00171             send(msg, gateBaseId("out"));
00172         }
00173         else
00174         {
00175             beQueue.insert(msg);
00176             notifyListeners();
00177             emit(beQueueLengthSignal, beQueue.length());
00178         }
00179     }

bool TTEOutput::isTransmissionAllowed ( EtherFrame *  message  )  [private, virtual]

Helper function to check whether a Messages is allowed to be transmitted.

The function checks whether a message fits in the gap until the next TT-message should be transmitted. It uses the message length to calculate the transmission duration.

Parameters:
message The message that should be transmitted
Returns:
true if transmission is allowed else false

Definition at line 300 of file TTEOutput.cc.

Referenced by handleMessage(), and requestPacket().

00301 {
00302     if (!outChannel)
00303     {
00304         return false;
00305     }
00306     //If there are no ttBuffers everything is fine
00307     if (ttBuffers.size() == 0)
00308     {
00309         return true;
00310     }
00311     TTEScheduler *scheduler = (TTEScheduler*) getParentModule()->getParentModule()->getSubmodule("tteScheduler");
00312     //SimTime sendTime = (message->getBitLength()+INTERFRAME_GAP_BITS)/txRate;
00313     SimTime sendTime = outChannel->calculateDuration(message);
00314     //Don't know if that is right, but it works!
00315     sendTime += (INTERFRAME_GAP_BITS + ((PREAMBLE_BYTES + SFD_BYTES) * 8)) / outChannel->getNominalDatarate();
00316     unsigned long sendTicks = ceil((sendTime / scheduler->par("tick")).dbl());
00317     unsigned long startTicks = ttBuffers[ttBuffersPos]->par("sendWindowStart").longValue();
00318     unsigned long endTicks = ttBuffers[ttBuffersPos]->par("sendWindowEnd").longValue();
00319 
00320     //Send Window Start is in next cycle
00321     if (scheduler->getTicks() > startTicks)
00322     {
00323         long cycleTicks = scheduler->par("cycle_ticks").longValue();
00324         startTicks += cycleTicks;
00325         endTicks += cycleTicks;
00326     }
00327     //Send Window End is in next cycle
00328     else if (scheduler->getTicks() > endTicks)
00329     {
00330         endTicks += scheduler->par("cycle_ticks").longValue();
00331     }
00332 
00333     //TODO: Perhaps more complex calculations needed?
00334     if ((scheduler->getTicks() + sendTicks) >= startTicks)
00335     {
00336         ev << "transmission not allowed!" << endl;
00337         return false;
00338     }
00339     return true;
00340 }

void TTEOutput::requestPacket (  )  [protected, virtual]

this method is invoked when the underlying mac is idle.

When this method is invoked the module sends a new message when there is one. Else it saves the state and sends the message immediately when it is received.

Definition at line 242 of file TTEOutput.cc.
